snippet: To the Editor:    The Feb. 12 letters responding to Brent Staples's Editorial Notebook (Feb. 10) seek to blame the collapse of California's schools not on the ''tax revolt'' and lack of money, but on teachers and teaching methods.  How do they acc...
lead_paragraph: To the Editor: The Feb. 12 letters responding to Brent Staples's Editorial Notebook (Feb. 10) seek to blame the collapse of California's schools not on the ''tax revolt'' and lack of money, but on teachers and teaching methods. How do they account for the similar decline of what was the finest system of public higher education in the world?
abstract: Linda M Maloney letter links decline of California college system to funding cuts

headline.main: Blame Judges, Not Voters, for California's Declining Schools
